  • Constructor Details

    • Gameboard

      public Gameboard()
      Constructs a new Gameboard, initializing the board and its various components. Creates a 7x7 grid of tiles, initializes the tile factory, sets a random generator for tile placement and movement, and sets the initial free tile as an angled tile. Calls the initializeBoard method to fill the board with tiles.

  • Method Details

    • getAllAccessibleTiles

      public List<Position> getAllAccessibleTiles(Position start)
      Retrieves all accessible tiles starting from a given position on the game board. The method explores the board to find all reachable positions, considering the paths and connections between tiles starting from the specified position. The visited tiles are reset before each call to ensure accurate exploration.
      Parameters:
      start - : starting position used to determine accessible tiles
      Returns:
      list of positions representing all accessible tiles from the start position

    • getNeighbors

      public List<Position> getNeighbors(Position current)
      Retrieves a list of neighboring positions adjacent to the given position on the game board. Positions are determined based on their immediate cardinal directions: up, down, left, and right.
      Parameters:
      current - : current position for which neighbors need to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a list of positions adjacent to the current position

    • addGameboardObserver

      public void addGameboardObserver(GameBoardObserver observer)
      Adds a GameBoardObserver to the list of observers for the gameboard. Observers are notified of changes to the gameboard state.
      Parameters:
      observer - : GameBoardObserver instance to be added

    • notifyGameboardChange

      public void notifyGameboardChange()
      Notifies all registered observers about a change in the gameboard's state. This method iterates over the list of GameBoardObserver objects and calls their update method, passing the current instance of the Gameboard as a parameter. It is used to inform observers that they should refresh or reconsider their state due to changes that occur in the gameboard.

    • getFreeTile

      public Tile getFreeTile()
      Retrieves the free tile currently available for movement or placement on the gameboard.
      Returns:
      the tile that is currently free, ready to be inserted into the board

    • setFreeTile

      public void setFreeTile(Tile freeTile)
      Sets the free tile for the gameboard. This tile is available for movement or placement within the board configuration. Setting a new free tile will trigger notifications to observers about the change in the gameboard state.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(Position position)
      Retrieves the tile located at the specified position on the gameboard.
      Parameters:
      position - : Position object containing the x and y coordinates for the tile location
      Returns:
      Tile object found at the given position on the gameboard

    • getObjectivePositions

      public List<Position> getObjectivePositions()
      Retrieves a list of positions where objectives (treasures) are located on the tiles.
      Returns:
      : list of 'Position' objects representing the coordinates of all tiles containing objectives.

    • getObjectivePosition

      public Position getObjectivePosition(int objectiveId)
      Retrieves the position of a specific objective on the game board.
      Parameters:
      objectiveId - : the unique identifier of the objective to locate.
      Returns:
      position of the objective as a Position object if found, or null if the objective is not on the board.

    • shiftRowLeft

      public boolean shiftRowLeft(int rowIndex)
      Shifts all tiles in the specified row one position to the left. The leftmost tile will be replaced by the current "free tile", and the rightmost tile in the row will become the new "free tile".
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - : index of the row to shift to the left. Must be within the bounds of the gameboard's rows.
      Returns:
      true if the row was successfully shifted to the left.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified row index is invalid.

    • shiftRowRight

      public boolean shiftRowRight(int rowIndex)
      Shifts all the tiles in the specified row one position to the right. The last tile in the row is moved to a free tile storage, and the first tile in the row is replaced with the free tile.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - : index of the row to shift. Must be a valid row index within the bounds of the game board.
      Returns:
      true if the row was successfully shifted; otherwise, false.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified row index is out of range.

    • shiftColumnUp

      public boolean shiftColumnUp(int colIndex)
      Shifts all the tiles in the specified column up by one position. The first tile in the column moves to the free tile, and the free tile replaces the last tile in the column. Notifies the gameboard of the change after the operation is completed.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - : index of the column to be shifted up
      Returns:
      true if the operation was performed successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is invalid

    • shiftColumnDown

      public boolean shiftColumnDown(int colIndex)
      Shifts all tiles in the specified column down by one position. The last tile in the column is moved to a separate "free tile" placeholder, while the column's first position is filled by the current free tile. Notifies the game board of changes if an update occurs.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - : index of the column to shift down. Must be a valid column index.
      Returns:
      boolean indicating whether the column was successfully shifted down.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided column index is out of bounds.

    • getAccessibleTiles

      public List<Position> getAccessibleTiles(Position position)
      Determines the list of accessible tiles from a given position based on the open sides of the current tile and the validity of adjacent tiles.
      Parameters:
      position - : current position to evaluate for accessible tiles.
      Returns:
      list of positions representing the tiles that are accessible from the given position.

    • isOppositeSideOpen

      public boolean isOppositeSideOpen(Position position, int oppositeSide)
      Checks if the opposite side of the neighboring tile at the specified position is open.
      Parameters:
      position - : position of the neighboring tile to be checked
      oppositeSide - : side of the neighboring tile to verify if it is open
      Returns:
      true if the opposite side of the neighboring tile is open; false otherwise
